Events

Scheduled events for 2016-2017.

Past events

    2017
    April

    YCS Presents: Tech Gala

    Come to the 1st annual Tech Gala, an end-of-year celebration of computer science at Yale!

    Friday, April 28th. 8-10pm.Grace Hopper Dining Hall.

    Facebook CodeLab

    Interview workshop hosted by Yale alumni now working as Facebook engineers!

    Tuesday, April 18th. 5-6pm.CEID.

    Hacknights Week 02

    Come to Hacknights Week 02! Food/drinks provided.

    Thursday, April 13th. 8-9pm.WLH 210.

    Daniel Friedman, Y '11

    Thiel Fellow, Forbes 30 Under 30 Social Innovator, and CEO of Thinkful, an online coding bootcamp that combines face-to-face learning with the accessibility of online education.

    Saturday, April 8th. 12.30-2pm.Bass L01-A.

    Hacknights Week 01

    Come to Hacknights Week 01! Food/drinks provided.

    Thursday, April 6th. 8-10pm.WLH 210.

    March

    Yusuf Simonson

    CTO at TheMuse (YCombinator W12), online jobs and career advice platform w/ 50M users and $28M in funding.

    Friday, March 31st. 4-6pm.WLH 113.

    Hacknights Week 00

    Join YCS for our inaugural Hack Nights! Code together with your friends on psets, projects, etc. while enjoying free food and drinks.

    Thursday, March 30th. 8-9pm.WLH 210.

    CS 477 Study Session

    Study for the upcoming NLP midterm together!

    Friday, March 3rd. 8-9pm.WLH 116.

    February

    CS 365 Study Session

    Study for the upcoming CPSC 365 midterm with friends and Insomnia cookies!

    Monday, February 27th. 3-4pm.WLH 211.

    YCS Grace Hopper Prize Info Session

    Come to the first info session for the Grace Hopper Prize and the Alan Perlis Prize for Newcomers

    Wednesday, February 15th. 9-10pm. WLH 114.

    2016
    December

    Study sessions for finals

    Come study with friends at the CEID. Check out our events on Facebook to find the times for you class. Lots of cookies await for you.

    All weekend, starting December 10th. CEID.

    Interview Workshop I

    Learn about the process of interviewing for the main tech companies, the coding challenges and how to prepare for them. Dinner (pizza & cookies) will be provided.

    Monday, December 5th. 7-9pm. AKW 100.

    November

    Julia Austin

    CTO at DigitalOcean and Senior Lecturer at Harvard Business School. Previously at VMWare and Akamai.

    Thursday, November 3rd. 11:45am-12:45. Lunch at the CEID.

List of Yale Computer Society Alumni.

The YCS is a undergraduate organization that promotes talks, workshops and study breaks related to computer science and engineering on Yale campus.

Email felipe.pires@y[you know the rest].edu with questions or suggestions.
